hanzi-su-wiki:
鎖

Значения

Цепь; закрывать

Мнемоника

Металлическая 金 цепь и замок для ларца с украшениями, мелкими 小 раковинами 貝. Закрывать, запирать. Мера длины якорных цепей в 22 ярда.

Варианты

锁

heisig_chinese_memo: The lock on this chain is made of little metal shells.
heisig_constituent: chain, metal, gold, small, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: Metal . . . little . . . shells. We have saved this character until no win order to draw attention to the visual difference between the owl and little. By now your eyes should be so accustomed to these apparently infinitesimal differences that the point is obvious.
koohiiStory1: The chain on this chainsaw is made of little metal shells.
koohiiStory2: A gold chain with small seashells hanging on it is in fashion these days.
jp_example_words:
封鎖(ふうさ): blockade, freezing (funds)
閉鎖(へいさ): closing, closure, shutdown, lockout, unsociable
鎖(くさり): chain
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The famous gold triceratops shellfish is good for only one thing, and that's being made into chains. They link their triceratops horns together and form an unbreakable gold chain. You can't eat them, because they're gold. So they're only really good for their chaining together ability.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture these little gold triceratops shellfish linked together by their horns in a chain around your neck. Feel them hanging there. Sparkly and cold.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: However, the only way to break the chain is to saw (さ) it open. Once the triceratops shellfish start holding on, they never let go. So when you want to take the chain off you have to really hack at it with your saw.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the saw in your hands, sawing back and forth on the gold chain around your neck. Maybe this isn't the best fashion accessory if you have to use a saw to get it off.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the small (小) shellfish (貝) has a gold (金) chain
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This is a small metal lock that looks like a shellfish.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Gold " to " 𧴪 ", it means a chain formed by connecting iron rings. "Mo Zi‧ Bei Mo Fu": "It is an iron lock, hooking the counties at both ends."

" Lock " can mean a sealing device that is placed on an openable and closable object and opened with a key or a password. "Shu Wenxin Attached to the Golden Ministry": "Locks, iron locks, and door keys." Tan Dufu "Recalling the Past": "Whoever disciple relies on the white hut, Lu Laodu opens the bronze lock."

" Lock " also means an instrument of torture made by connecting iron rings. "Han Shu·Wang Mang's Passage": "The man slams the car, and the child walks with the woman, with a chain of iron as his neck."

" Lock " also means to lock and put on. Tang Hanyu, "The Lin Pavilion of the Xiao Family by Feng He Li Xianggong": "The deep and deep gates of the cave are completely locked. How many people know about it because of the prime minister?"

" Lock " can be extended to restraint. Han Dongfang Shuo "Book with Friends": "Don't let the name of the dustnet be restrained."

" Lock " also means blockade. Tang Bai Juyi's "Farewell": "The solitary bird is locked in the deep cage at night, and the sword spring breaks the branches."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " gold " and " 𧴪 ", it means a chain formed by connecting iron rings.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「𧴪」聲，表示以鐵環相勾連而成的鏈子。《墨子‧備蛾傅》：「為鐵鎖，鉤其兩端之縣。」

　　「鎖」可表示置於可啟閉的器物上，以鑰匙或暗碼打開的封缄器。《說文新附‧金部》：「鎖，鐵鎖，門鍵也。」唐杜甫〈憶昔行〉：「弟子誰依白茅屋，盧老獨啟青銅鎖。」

　　「鎖」還表示以鐵環勾連而成的刑具。《漢書‧王莽傳下》：「其男子檻車，兒女子步，以鐵鎖琅當其頸。」

　　「鎖」也表示鎖上、套上。唐韓愈〈奉和李相公題蕭家林亭〉：「巖洞幽深門盡鎖，不因丞相幾人知？」

　　「鎖」可引申為束縛。漢東方朔〈與友人書〉：「不可使塵網名韁拘鎖。」

　　「鎖」亦表示封鎖。唐白居易〈潛別離〉：「深籠夜鎖獨棲鳥，利劍春斷連理枝。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「𧴪」聲，表示以鐵環相勾連而成的鏈子。

從「 金 」，「 𧴪 」聲，表示以鐵環相勾連而成的鏈子。《墨子‧備蛾傅》：「為鐵鎖，鉤其兩端之縣。」 「 鎖 」可表示置於可啟閉的器物上，以鑰匙或暗碼打開的封缄器。《說文新附‧金部》：「鎖，鐵鎖，門鍵也。」唐杜甫〈憶昔行〉：「弟子誰依白茅屋，盧老獨啟青銅鎖。」 「 鎖 」還表示以鐵環勾連而成的刑具。《漢書‧王莽傳下》：「其男子檻車，兒女子步，以鐵鎖琅當其頸。」 「 鎖 」也表示鎖上、套上。唐韓愈〈奉和李相公題蕭家林亭〉：「巖洞幽深門盡鎖，不因丞相幾人知？」 「 鎖 」可引申為束縛。漢東方朔〈與友人書〉：「不可使塵網名韁拘鎖。」 「 鎖 」亦表示封鎖。唐白居易〈潛別離〉：「深籠夜鎖獨棲鳥，利劍春斷連理枝。」
From the sound of " Gold" to " 𧴪", it means a chain formed by connecting iron rings. "Mo Zi‧ Bei Mo Fu": "It is an iron lock, hooking the counties at both ends." " Lock" can mean a sealing device that is placed on an openable and closable object and opened with a key or a password. "Shu Wenxin Attached to the Golden Ministry": "Locks, iron locks, and door keys." Tan Dufu "Recalling the Past": "Whoever disciple relies on the white hut, Lu Laodu opens the bronze lock." " Lock" also means an instrument of torture made by connecting iron rings. "Han Shu·Wang Mang's Passage": "The man slams the car, and the child walks with the woman, with a chain of iron as his neck." " Lock" also means to lock and put on. Tang Hanyu, "The Lin Pavilion of the Xiao Family by Feng He Li Xianggong": "The deep and deep gates of the cave are completely locked. How many people know about it because of the prime minister?" " Lock" can be extended to restraint. Han Dongfang Shuo "Book with Friends": "Don't let the name of the dustnet be restrained." " Lock" also means blockade. Tang Bai Juyi's "Farewell": "The solitary bird is locked in the deep cage at night, and the sword spring breaks the branches."

鎖字的基本解释

鎖
suǒ
见“锁”。

鎖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［suǒ］
［《廣韻》蘇果切，上果，心。］
“锁1”的繁体字。亦作“鎻1”。亦作“鏁1”。
(1)以铁环相勾连而成的链子。
(2)以铁环勾连而成的刑具。
(3)雕镂或绘画的连环形花纹。参见“鎖窗”。
(4)一种缝纫方法。用于衣物边缘或扣眼上，针脚很密，线斜交或钩连。参见“鎖口”。
(5)拘系；束缚。
(6)安在门窗箱匣等开合处，或铁链的环孔中，通常用钥匙打开的金属器具。
(7)指像锁一样的东西。
(8)把锁锁上。
(9)封闭；封锁。
(10)皱（眉）。
(11)通“瑣”。细碎。参见“鎖事”、“鎖碎”。
(12)姓。明有锁以忠。见明顾起元《客座赘语·僻姓》。

鎖字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鎖； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1317第05
【唐韻】【正韻】蘇果切【集韻】【韻會】損果切，?音瑣。【說文】鐵鎖，門鍵也。【集韻】鋃鐺也。【前漢·王莽傳】以鐵鎖琅當其頸。【註】琅當，長鏁也。【班固·敘傳】繫名聲之韁鎖。【抱朴子·逸民卷】屈龍淵爲錐鎖之用。　又【正字通】鎖子甲，五環相互，一環受鏃，諸環拱護，故箭不能入。【杜甫詩】雨拋金鎖甲。　【集韻】或作鏁。

鎖字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鎖字的起名意思

暂无。

lock
Basic explanation of words
lock
suǒ
See "lock".
lock
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［suǒ］
["Guangyun" Suguo cut, fruit, heart. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "锁1". Also known as "鎻1". Also known as "鏁1".
(1) A chain formed by connecting iron rings.
(2) An instrument of torture formed by hooking up iron rings.
(3) Carved or painted circular patterns. See "Lock Window".
(4) A sewing method. Used on the edge of clothing or buttonholes, the stitches are dense, the threads are diagonally crossed or hooked. See "Lock".
(5) Restraint; restraint.
(6) Metal appliances that are usually opened with a key at the opening and closing of doors, windows, boxes, etc., or in the ring holes of iron chains.
(7) Refers to something like a lock.
(8) Lock the lock.
(9) Closed; blocked.
(10) Frowning (eyebrows).
(11) Link "Sorry". Finely chopped. See "locking things", "locking broken".
(12) Last name. Obviously there is a lock to be loyal. See Ming Gu Qiyuan's "Gu Qiyuan".
lock
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Lock; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1317 05
[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Su Guoqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Lose the fruit and cut it, and the sound is trivial. [Said the text] Iron locks, door keys also. 【Ji Yun】Chang Cang Ye. [Previous Han·Wang Mang Biography] With iron lock lang as its neck. [Note] Langdang, Chang Jia also. [Ban Gu·Xu Chuan] is the rein of fame. [Baopuzi·Yimin Volume] Qu Longyuan is used for cone locks.　[Zhengzitong] The chain mail, the five rings are mutually, one ring is protected by the arrow, and all the rings are arched, so arrows cannot enter. [Poems of Du Fu] Rain throws golden locks.　【Jiyun】Or make 鏁.

Name meaning

suǒ
вм. 锁
Radicals: 金, 貝  (gold, shellfish, triceratops)
Meaning Mnemonic
The famous gold triceratops shellfish is good for only one thing, and that's being made into chains. They link their triceratops horns together and form an unbreakable gold chain. You can't eat them, because they're gold. So they're only really good for their chaining together ability.
Picture these little gold triceratops shellfish linked together by their horns in a chain around your neck. Feel them hanging there. Sparkly and cold.
Reading Mnemonic
However, the only way to break the chain is to saw (さ) it open. Once the triceratops shellfish start holding on, they never let go. So when you want to take the chain off you have to really hack at it with your saw.
Picture the saw in your hands, sawing back and forth on the gold chain around your neck. Maybe this isn't the best fashion accessory if you have to use a saw to get it off.
